modName: GUIDE - Manual Cleaning Master ESMs For Skyrim and Skyrim SE
summary: A guide for everyone who need their ESM masters cleaned but dont know how. Update.esm, Dawnguard.esm, Hearthfires.esm and Dragonborn.esm
descriptionHtml:
[center]
[u][color=#ffd966][size=5]Cleaning the Official Master ESMs[/size][/color][/u]


[size=4][b]This guide assumes using [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/25859/?]TES5Edit v3.2.1[/url] on Skyrim Nexus,[/b]
[b]Or [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/164/?]SSEEdit v3.2.1[/url] on Skyrim SE Nexus[/b]


Due to this guide being dual purpose ( For Skyrim and Skyrim SE ) for the rest of this guide I will refer to both tools as [b]xEdit.[/b]
Screenshots of tools used may be one or the other, or older versions, which does not matter, the images are only to illustrate the method / options used.

Why Clean the Master Files ?[/size]
[spoiler]
Firstly because the masters have entries that are [u][b]identical[/b][/u] to the same records in Skyrim.esm or other DLC esms'. They exist because Bethesda may have looked at something in the CK and an unneeded entry was auto included in the plugin even though the item was not altered in any way. The Official Creation Kits are notoriously buggy and randomly create dirty / wild edits, often when the author of the plugin is completely unaware. Wherever that plugin is placed in your load order its records overwrite all the conflicting records from plugins loaded before it ( the rule of one ) resetting the settings back to the values contained in the Official Bethesda DLC. It won't cause crashes, it just changes the values of plugins loaded before it. Which can alter mods that you have for Weapon Damage, Armor, Lighting, Food Effects and so on. The masters are very early in your load order but there is potential for a mod to be made as a fake.esm, and placed among them, and so ITMs in a later loading master may cause problems for that mods esm. Chance is remote that a master will affect another master, and this procedure is best used on all of your mods plugins, but cleaning everything of ITMs ( Identical to Master records ) causes no harm, is more optimal giving the game less to process in your load order, and so it is best to get rid of these completely unnecessary dirty edits.

The Second reason is that Bethesda chose to delete some things that are in the Official DLC. Any mods loaded with references to deleted records from the Official Bethesda DLC will cause your game to crash. This problem particularly affects older mods ( especially mods that were made before newer official patches were released, with more deleted references the old mod did not anticipate - It will also become problematic for the Skyrim Special Edition community where old Original Skyrim mods are being converted to SSE, and Bethesda have deleted even more records from the plugins before they released the newer plugins for that version of the game ). xEdit can restore and properly assign values to these records that will disable them and still allow mods to access them. This is done using the "Undelete and Disable References" option.

For further explanations of why it is still recommended to clean the games masters .. Read on from [url=https://afkmods.iguanadons.net/index.php?/topic/4110-manual-cleaning-skyrim-and-skyrim-se-master-files/&page=4#comment-166166]this post[/url],
Zilav and Arthmoor, most valued technical and vastly experienced modding authors, weigh in on the subject.

The following mostly apply to mod authors, but worth knowing about for mod users too :

xEdit will also report when a mod has Deleted NavMeshes as part of the report from Automatic cleaning. Like deleted references, any mod that references a deleted NavMesh will cause Skyrim to Crash. Properly optimizing your mods NavMeshes and checking your mod for Deleted Vanilla NavMeshes ( which can also be caused by a CK wild edit even if you did not do it yourself ) is important. Mods altering the same cell and the same NavMeshes when your mod is not optimized will cause Skyrim to Crash. Poorly optimized NavMeshes with errors reported by the CK will make Skyrim unstable. Instabilities like fast travelling to a location and Skyrim crashes. Note the ones found to be deleted in the games masters, cannot be undeleted. To fix deleted Navmeshes in your mods, Arthmoor has provided a walkthrough in [url=https://afkmods.iguanadons.net/index.php?/topic/3337-skyrim-fixing-navmesh-deletion-using-tes5edit]Skyrim - Fixing Navmesh Deletion in TES5Edit

[/url]Manually cleaning your mods is also important to remove wild edits. This is mostly down to the experience of Mod Authors to solve such problems, but there are a few noted later in this guide which are in the DLCs which everyone can easily Manually clean. Some mods can have accidental Wild Edits in them caused by the author looking at how Bethesda did something they wish their mod to do as well. These Wild Edits often prevent Skyrim from doing things like advancing quests, spawning NPCs, assigning dialogue to NPCs, preventing NPCs from patrol areas they are assigned to. They can also alter Vanilla Lighting and Triggers that the author wished to use. All of these things affect any plugin with conflicting records loaded before a mod with Wild Edits.

Mod authors - Learn to use xEdit, and ensure the only records in your mod plugins are what you would expect to be in there, its the most important tool the community can make use of when used properly.

Mod Users - Follow this guide...
[/spoiler]
[size=4]
Before moving on to the Manual cleaning, something everyone should do prior to Manual Cleaning :[/size]


[u][color=#00ffff][size=5][b]Automatic cleaning[/b] of Bethesda's ESMs with xEdit[/size][/color][/u]

[size=4]With the games [/size][i]Original esm's[/i][size=4] installed ( You can use Steam to [/size][url=https://support.steampowered.com/kb_article.php?ref=2037-QEUH-3335]Verify Integrity of Game Cache[/url][size=4] of Skyrims files to ensure you have good error free copies of the original master files ), and in accordance with the following wiki article [/size][url=http://www.creationkit.com/index.php?title=Skyrim_Dirty_Plugins_List]http://www.creationkit.com/index.php?title=Skyrim_Dirty_Plugins_List[/url][size=4] :[/size]



[size=5]Load up xEdit.[/size]

[size=4][color=#00ffff]1.[/color] Right click the plugin selection screen and select "none"[/size]


[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1704/images/4947-0-1487853683.png[/img]


[size=4][color=#00ffff]2.[/color] Tick the relevant esm to edit, and click okay ( If you have not cleaned any of your Master files yet, the first one to tick will be Skyrims "Update.esm" ), then click Okay[/size]


[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1704/images/4947-1-1487853683.png[/img]


[size=4][i]After [u]each[/u] of the following actions, wait for a message in the message window that the previous operation has [/i][i]finished / Done[/i] :

[color=#00ffff]3.[/color] Right click the plugin after you get the "Background Loader : Finished" message,and choose "Apply Filter for Cleaning"[/size]


[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1704/images/4947-2-1487853683.png[/img]


[size=4]Wait until Filtering is finished then ..

[color=#00ffff]4.[/color] Right click the plugin and choose Remove Identical to Master Records[/size]


[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1704/images/4947-3-1487853683.png[/img]


[size=4]Wait until it finishes then ..

[color=#00ffff]5.[/color] Right click the plugin and choose Undelete and Disable references[/size]


[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1704/images/4947-4-1487853683.png[/img]


[size=4]Wait until it finishes then ..[/size]

[size=4][color=#00ffff]6.[/color] Close xEdit, and it should check with you that you wish to save the plugin ( this only happens if you have made any changes to the plugin to save, if it just closes .. Then you have not cleaned anything )[/size]



[size=4]Rinse and repeat the Automatic cleaning ( steps 1 - 6 above ) for each of the master files.[/size]

[size=4]Working from first to load, to last, [/size][u][b]not[/b][/u][size=4] including Skyrim.esm or any unofficial patches[/size]
[size=4]( No point doing Skyrim.esm, and the unofficial patches are already done and should not be cleaned )[/size]

[size=4]So clean in this order[/size]

[size=4]Update.esm[/size]

[size=4]Dawnguard.esm[/size]

[size=4]Dawnguard.esm ( Yes it needs to be done twice )[/size]

[size=4]Hearthfire.esm[/size]

[size=4]Dragonborn.esm[/size]


[b]Dawnguard.esm needs to be [u]cleaned twice[/u][/b][size=4] ( as of xEdit 3.1 onwards - After doing the automatic cleaning routine once on Dawnguard.esm, and saving it, load it up again in xEdit and you will be able to clean a further 6 ITMs ) :[/size]



[b][color=#ffe599][size=5]Skyrim Original[/size][/color][/b]

[color=#b4a7d6][size=4]Update.esm[/size][/color]
[color=#ff00ff][size=4]Apply filter for cleaning[/size][/color]
[size=4][Removing "Identical to Master" records done]  Processed Records: 1290, Removed Records: [color=#ffff00]96[/color][/size]
[size=4][Undeleting and Disabling References done]  Processed Records: 1194, Undeleted Records: [color=#ffff00]3[/color][/size]

[size=4][color=#b4a7d6]Dawnguard.esm[/color] ( [/size][i][b]First time around[/b][/i][size=4] )[/size]
[color=#ff00ff][size=4]Apply filter for cleaning[/size][/color]
[size=4][Removing "Identical to Master" records done]  Processed Records: 98027, Removed Records: [color=#ffff00]630[/color][/size]
[size=4][Undeleting and Disabling References done]  Processed Records: 97397, Undeleted Records: [color=#ffff00]82[/color][/size]
[size=4]<Warning: Plugin contains 57 deleted NavMeshes which can not be undeleted>[/size]
[size=4][color=#b4a7d6]Dawnguard.esm[/color] ( [/size][i][b]Second time around[/b][/i][size=4] )[/size]
[color=#ff00ff][size=4]Apply filter for cleaning[/size][/color]
[size=4][Removing "Identical to Master" records done]  Processed Records: 97396, Removed Records: [color=#ffff00]6[/color][/size]
[size=4][Undeleting and Disabling References done]  Processed Records: 97390, Undeleted Records: 0[/size]
[size=4]<Warning: Plugin contains 57 deleted NavMeshes which can not be undeleted>[/size]

[color=#b4a7d6][size=4]Hearthfires.esm[/size][/color]
[color=#ff00ff][size=4]Apply filter for cleaning[/size][/color]
[size=4][Removing "Identical to Master" records done]  Processed Records: 17797, Removed Records: [color=#ffff00]184[/color][/size]
[size=4][Undeleting and Disabling References done]  Processed Records: 17613, Undeleted Records: [color=#ffff00]11[/color][/size]
[size=4]<Warning: Plugin contains 5 deleted NavMeshes which can not be undeleted>[/size]

[color=#b4a7d6][size=4]Dragonborn.esm[/size][/color]
[color=#ff00ff][size=4]Apply filter for cleaning[/size][/color]
[size=4][Removing "Identical to Master" records done]  Processed Records: 214386, Removed Records: [color=#ffff00]68[/color][/size]
[size=4][Undeleting and Disabling References done]  Processed Records: 214318, Undeleted Records: [color=#ffff00]8[/color][/size]
[size=4]<Warning: Plugin contains 1 deleted NavMeshes which can not be undeleted>[/size]




[b][color=#ffe599][size=5]Skyrim Special Edition[/size][/color][/b]

[color=#b4a7d6][size=4]Update.esm[/size][/color]
[color=#ff00ff][size=4]Apply filter for cleaning[/size][/color]
[size=4][Removing "Identical to Master" records done]  Processed Records: 17644, Removed Records: [color=#ffff00]239[/color][/size]
[size=4][Undeleting and Disabling References done]  Processed Records: 17405, Undeleted Records: [color=#ffff00]91[/color][/size]
<Warning: Plugin contains 2 deleted NavMeshes which can not be undeleted>

[size=4][color=#b4a7d6]Dawnguard.esm[/color] ( [/size][i][b]First time around[/b][/i][size=4] )[/size]
[color=#ff00ff][size=4]Apply filter for cleaning[/size][/color]
[size=4][Removing "Identical to Master" records done]  Processed Records: 98676, Removed Records: [color=#ffff00]621[/color][/size]
[size=4][Undeleting and Disabling References done]  Processed Records: 98055, Undeleted Records: [color=#ffff00]82[/color][/size]
[size=4]<Warning: Plugin contains 57 deleted NavMeshes which can not be undeleted>[/size]
[size=4][color=#b4a7d6]Dawnguard.esm[/color] ( [/size][i][b]Second time around[/b][/i][size=4] )[/size]
[color=#ff00ff][size=4]Apply filter for cleaning[/size][/color]
[size=4][Removing "Identical to Master" records done]  Processed Records: 98054, Removed Records: [color=#ffff00]6[/color][/size]
[size=4][Undeleting and Disabling References done]  Processed Records: 98048, Undeleted Records: 0[/size]
[size=4]<Warning: Plugin contains 57 deleted NavMeshes which can not be undeleted>[/size]

[color=#b4a7d6][size=4]Hearthfires.esm[/size][/color]
[color=#ff00ff][size=4]Apply filter for cleaning[/size][/color]
[size=4][Removing "Identical to Master" records done]  Processed Records: 18539, Removed Records: [color=#ffff00]178[/color][/size]
[size=4][Undeleting and Disabling References done]  Processed Records: 18361, Undeleted Records: [color=#ffff00]11[/color][/size]
[size=4]<Warning: Plugin contains 5 deleted NavMeshes which can not be undeleted>[/size]

[color=#b4a7d6][size=4]Dragonborn.esm[/size][/color]
[color=#ff00ff][size=4]Apply filter for cleaning[/size][/color]
[size=4][Removing "Identical to Master" records done]  Processed Records: 214498, Removed Records: [color=#ffff00]69[/color][/size]
[size=4][Undeleting and Disabling References done]  Processed Records: 214429, Undeleted Records: [color=#ffff00]8[/color][/size]
[size=4]<Warning: Plugin contains 1 deleted NavMeshes which can not be undeleted>[/size]


------------------



[b][u][color=#00ffff][size=5]Dawnguard.esm needs manual cleaning aswell as automatic cleaning[/size][/color][/u][/b]


[size=4]After the automated cleaning is done, you can also now manually clean a few more Wild edits xEdit will not have touched ...[/size]

[size=4]Recently Arthmoor has brought to the attention of the community additional information regarding manual cleaning of Dawnguard.esm, which everyone needs to do for their own setup same as automatic cleaning ( because nobody can legally upload official master files anywhere, everyone needs to do their own )[/size]



[size=5]First load up xEdit[/size]

[size=4]When the plugin selection comes up, right click and select None[/size]
[size=4]Then put a tick in the box just for Dawnguard.esm, click Okay[/size]
[size=4]After its finished loading, right click Dawnguard.esm and choose "Filter for Cleaning"[/size]


[size=4][color=#00ffff]1.[/color] For "CELL 00016BCF: Remove XEZN subrecord referring to RiftenRatwayZone [ECZN:0009FBB9]. Otherwise it blocks the official fix in Update.esm." .... Expand the records as in the following screenshot, and right click the indicated sub-record, and choose Remove[/size]


[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1704/images/4947-0-1487895490.png[/img]


[size=4][color=#00ffff]2.[/color] For "CELL 0001FA4C: Wild edit. Remove this record. It's a testing cell." .... Expand the records as in the following screenshot, and right click the indicated record, and choose Remove[/size]


[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1704/images/4947-1-1487895490.png[/img]


[size=4][color=#00ffff]3.[/color] For "CELL 0006C3B6: Wild edit. Remove this record. It's a testing cell." .... Expand the records as in the following screenshot, and right click the indicated record, and choose Remove[/size]


[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1704/images/4947-2-1487895489.png[/img]


[size=4][b]NOTE : This guide used to include cleaning instructions for "[/b][b]CELL 00039F67: Wild edit. Remove this record. It's a testing cell[/b][/size][b][size=4]" ( The WICourier edit ) - But since the new version of TES5Edit 3.1+ now cleans that as part of the automated cleaning ( which you should have done prior to manual cleaning ), you no longer need to clean it manually afterwards.[/size][/b]


[b]-----------------------------------------[/b]



[b][color=#00ffff][size=5]CRCs of the various stages for comparison
( The following cleaned with xEdit 3.2.1 )[/size][/color][/b]



[u][b][color=#ffe599][size=5]Skyrim Original
[/size][/color][/b][/u]

[img]https://afkmods.iguanadons.net/uploads/monthly_2017_02/large.58a9537fe36bf_TES5EditMasterCRCs.png.87ac6e137b22bdc79840018643ae7c33.png[/img]

[size=4]Update.esm Original - [color=#ffff00]CRC[/color] = E5B67BDA [color=#ff00ff]MD5[/color] = 2476E42699D4D9236DDD2EA8B31F612D
Update.esm Auto Clean - [color=#ffff00]CRC[/color] = 18401373 [color=#ff00ff]MD5[/color] = 27CF2C3E379BC853F4AC574BCEC7A0B9
Dawnguard.esm Original - [color=#ffff00]CRC[/color] = BD72CCF3 [color=#ff00ff]MD5[/color] = 5BD2F339925A5FB96F9F0DA7F96FD8CE
Dawnguard.esm Auto Clean First time - [color=#ffff00]CRC[/color] = 6391C6DC [color=#ff00ff]MD5[/color] = 0602D8450CC51F8C9EF8AB531B6EDAEB
Dawnguard.esm Auto Clean Second time - [color=#ffff00]CRC[/color] = 94A47F31 [color=#ff00ff]MD5[/color] = D3D38017BCDA07C1ABB1C343A9266634
Dawnguard.esm Auto plus Manual Clean - [color=#ffff00]CRC[/color] = 50FB6A39 [color=#ff00ff]MD5[/color] = 74561A2CF8644ACC8BE857E0705996D5
Hearthfire.esm Original - [color=#ffff00]CRC[/color] = AF82CE6A [color=#ff00ff]MD5[/color] = 71C3D20EA9F8510E29C36F2A426247C2
Hearthfire.esm Auto Clean - [color=#ffff00]CRC[/color] = FBB4B8FA [color=#ff00ff]MD5[/color] = E91E103C7F541C34F7CDD53AD68EDA3A
Dragonborn.esm Original - [color=#ffff00]CRC[/color] = A9F83BFF [color=#ff00ff]MD5[/color] = 37D8CBFFCB460011CE2BF3AABD007A2D
Dragonborn.esm Auto Clean - [color=#ffff00]CRC[/color] = E0715431 [color=#ff00ff]MD5[/color] = 7D78A3CA1E4D3700DB5D7F5DDAF5F7D2[/size]



[u][b][color=#ffe599][size=5]Skyrim Special Edition
[/size][/color][/b][/u]
[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/82342/82342-1524416401-1212314169.png[/img]

[size=4]Update.esm Original - [color=#ffff00]CRC[/color] = fe610a99 [color=#ff00ff]MD5[/color] = 70D089E0F55620127E8087A19285EC4B
Update.esm Auto Clean - [color=#ffff00]CRC[/color] = c18ee18c [color=#ff00ff]MD5[/color] = 0D1793153B88691EAD5865DACD4D0EC0
Dawnguard.esm Original - [color=#ffff00]CRC[/color] = 81a481e8 [color=#ff00ff]MD5[/color] = 055FAAD4A75321F6439ABA05BEA9FD06
Dawnguard.esm Auto Clean First time - [color=#ffff00]CRC[/color] = 6f162d5e [color=#ff00ff]MD5[/color] = D449836BD497593E967A4AE880E9DD75
Dawnguard.esm Auto Clean Second time - [color=#ffff00]CRC[/color] = 6061bcff [color=#ff00ff]MD5[/color] = 192F2D3C115B9CD859192DECBA89D7A5
Dawnguard.esm Auto plus Manual Clean - [color=#ffff00]CRC[/color] = 141be1e5 [color=#ff00ff]MD5[/color] = 18E1A883F28F938AAAF720EAFC39D2BE
Hearthfire.esm Original - [color=#ffff00]CRC[/color] = a631401b [color=#ff00ff]MD5[/color] = B42D76EA5E863FD47DBB83213FF00484
Hearthfire.esm Auto Clean - [color=#ffff00]CRC[/color] = 0ed37282 [color=#ff00ff]MD5[/color] = 3EF5D1E32AF8BFA6568A0E9BE408737E
Dragonborn.esm Original - [color=#ffff00]CRC[/color] =  64625bcd [color=#ff00ff]MD5[/color] = BF9B92C5B70EDF5C4DE074B64532A30A
Dragonborn.esm Auto Clean - [color=#ffff00]CRC[/color] = 5eb9eade [color=#ff00ff]MD5[/color] = C075133B06C986E7218DAA59C1D8906F



[b]( Note : If there is only one file inside a folder within a zip, 7zip shows that files CRC alongside the folder - I checked each plugins within the folders individually to be sure the Screenshot CRCs above are all correct, and of course they also match the online CRC checks )


[/b]Now that the Master files are cleaned, you can go through the rest of your Load Order using Automatic cleaning of ITMs and UDRs on all your mods plugins. The sequence of cleaning mods plugins should be after you have your Load Order correct, clean them with the last to load being the last to clean. Mod authors should have done them already, so most will probably not need cleaning. Also look out for any mod specific cleaning instructions in the mods description. For example the Unofficial Patches will not need any cleaning, they are already done, and the remaining ITMs in those plugins should be left alone because they do have a purpose ..
( its a very rare occasion when this is true ).


[u]For [b]Wrye Bash[/b] users[/u] : To make a BAIN for easy re-installations - Using the file uploaded here on [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/82342/?]Nexus[/url] as a template, extract it, put your Original and Cleaned esm's into the correct folders, then repack the whole thing as a Wrye Bash BAIN for easy installation ..

[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/82342-0-1488636089.png[/img]
[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/1704/images/4947-0-1487728400.png[/img]


( [color=#00ffff]YOU NEED TO DO YOUR OWN BECAUSE BETHESDA DO NOT ALLOW UPLOADING OF ITS MASTER PLUGINS[/color] )


To check CRCs Drag and Drop resulting files here [url=https://emn178.github.io/online-tools/crc32_checksum.html]https://emn178.github.io/online-tools/crc32_checksum.html[/url]

To Check MD5 checksums Drag and Drop resulting files here [url=http://onlinemd5.com/]http://onlinemd5.com/[/url]

[b]The xEdit Work In Progress Development topic is at the following link [/b]
[url=https://afkmods.iguanadons.net/index.php?/topic/3750-wipz-tes5edit/page-20#entry152079]http://afkmods.iguanadons.net/index.php?/topic/3750-wipz-tes5edit/page-20#entry152079[/url][/size][size=4][url=https://afkmods.iguanadons.net/index.php?/topic/3750-wipz-tes5edit/page-20#entry152079][/url][/size][/center]
author: alt3rn1ty
